definition: to select/to choose/to pick over/to pick out/to differentiate/to eliminate/also pr. [zhai2]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
fine time, lucky day (idiom); fig. good opportunity
to send the betrothal gifts/(fig.) to conclude a marriage

to enquire, according to custom, after the name and horoscope of intended bride/one of a set of six traditional marriage protocols (六禮|六礼), in which name as well as date and time of birth (for horoscope) are formally requested of the prospective bride's family
casting a couple's fortune based on their bithdates (old)
one's birth data for astrological purposes, combined from year, month, day, hour, heavenly trunk and earthly branch
to have one's fortune read/system of fortune telling based on a person's date and time of birth, according to 干支 (sexagenary cycle)
to fix a date (for an event)/to select an auspicious date
